relation: Campus Security works 24/7 even through natural disasters. There are almost 300 officers working all over campus. You will see them in cars, on segways, jeeps, scooters, bikes, in buildings, dorms and also in houses checking cars coming into the university.
Almost every fraternity and sorority you can think of including Christian sororities and fraternities
Over 300 clubs and organizations to join.

Campus is lively everyday. With over 300 student organizations, campus events planned by Student Affairs, there is something fun to do. Even if it's nothing but sitting on the yard with friends, you are going to have fun.

You have many options when it comes to eating. You can eat in the cafe which is different everyday and Thursdays are Soul Food Thursdays or you can eat in what is called the Punchout (Food Court) which has Chinese food, sub shop, pizza place, pasta place and a chicken place. If you want to take your special someone on a date, there is also an elegant restaurant that you can go to.

Living in the dorms, everyone becomes your brother/sister. Freshman live in same sex dorms so you'll develop a bond that will last. You get to the point where you study together, eat together and hang out together.

The courses are rigorous. All professors have their Ph.D and give you the best resources possible. It's up to you whether you are receptive and willing to work hard or give up because it seems like it's too much for you.

If you really want to get the education and skill necessary to make it in this country, Howard University is the place. Make sure you have good test scores, leadership capabilities, good work ethic and a people person.

Howard is an incredible institution. Not only are giving the knowledge needed to become successful, you meet with business owners, entertainment moguls, politicians and world leaders while you're matriculating. The best college experience that you can receive.

textAfterTable: Tips for prospective students Don't party too hard during your first semester. I know several people who will not be able to complete their education at Howard because they were the ones getting ready every Thursday/Friday/Saturday night for the club instead of studying. Also be aware of your surroundings. Travel in large groups during the night and use the shuttles as much as possible so you won't have to worry about walking back to the dorms all the way from the metro. When you're about to buy books for classes, ask upperclassmen and look around campus for flyers of people selling their books for cheaper than the bookstore prices. Join clubs and community service organizations to build up your experience for those future internships and jobs. Stay focused on your grades. It is, after all, the reason why you'll be here in the first place so why not sit down with a friend and study!! Use your professors' office hours and sit in the front of the class. Use study groups for help before big tests and finals. There are so many libraries that you can go for quiet time and research. Lastly, have fun. The next 4 years will change your life forever. Howard has birthed thousands of successful people and the legacy will continue with you if you put forth the effort. Bang for the buck While Howard
